tokens: bureau of ocean energy management regulation and enforcement 20240 november 18,2010 the washington post 1150 15 th street n.w 20071 ref mms-2010-00243 dear mr. this response freedom ofinformation act fora request dated june 2010 received office june 2010 in request sought `` correspondence since january 1,2004 regulation enforcement boemre members staff members correspondence boemre committees staff members '' we writing today provide partial response enclosed approximately 1,553 pages documents responsive request several pages partially redacted citing following exemptions exemption foia u.s.c 552 b exemption foia 552 b exemption exemption protects public disclosure records related internal personnel rules practices agency it includes two distinct categories records `` low '' dealing internal matters relatively trivial nature legitimate public interest benefit applicable would impose administrative burden agency process release requested records `` high '' substantive disclosure would allow circumvention statute agency regulation the premise `` high '' disclosure would benefit attempting violate law avoid detection we determined fixed conference call codes belong category information likely result harmful circumvention `` high '' exemption personal cellular telephone numbers personal email addresses residential addresses residential telephone numbers when disclosure information particular individual requested must detennine whether release information would constitute clearly `` unwarranted '' invasion individual privacy v. 124 s. ct. 1570 1580 2004 to make determination required perform `` balancing test '' this means must weigh individual 's right privacy public 's right disclosure first must determine whether individual discernable privacy interest information requested next must detennine whether release information would serve `` public interest generally '' i.e. whether would `` shed light performance agency 's statutory duties '' finally must determine whether public interest disclosure greater privacy interest individual withholding the information withholding consists solely category infonnation determined individuals information pertains substantial privacy interest additionally determined disclosure information would shed little light performance agency 's statutory duties public interest served disclosure outweigh privacy interest individuals question withholding i employees v. homer 879 f.2d 873 879 d.c. cir 1989 mr. office solicitor consulted reaching decisions if disagree determination right appeal regulation 43 cfr part subpart d writing attn solicitor mail stop 6556 1849 c. street d .c 20240 the foia appeals officer must receive foia appeal later 30 workdays date final letter 30 workdays receipt records provided responding foia request appeals arriving delivered p .m e.t. monday friday deemed received next workday the appeal must marked envelope face appeal letter legend `` freedom of information appeal '' you must include appeal copies correspondence bureau concerning foia request including copy original request letter failure include documentation appeal result department 's rej ection appeal your letter include much detail possible reason believe bureaus response error because voluminous nature request extensive review required document additional time needed complete foia request please assured request handled quickly possible we continue send partial responses request fully completed we regret delay appreciate understanding matter deals tremendous influx requests received due bpdeepwater horizon oil spill tragedy you right treat delay denial request you may appeal matter following procedure outlined should additional questions please contact 703-787-1689 deborah.kimball boemre.gov sincerely .. boemre foia officer enclosures

from to cc subject date energy re another revenue question friday july 10 20096:23:54 pm thanks much try ballpark estimate generally run thanks linda from mailto lyn.herdt mms.gov sent wednesday july 08 2009 8:41 am to energy cc subject re another revenue question complete analysis potential revenues ocs areas would multi-month project the best offer refer revenue analysisestimate developed opp the opp issued january 09 included estimate bonus bids royalties generated leases issued proposed lease sales i attached full opp information the 2nd attachment provides table a proposed schedule lease sales table b estimate leasing revenues state shares sales might occur within areas proposed leasing the individual planning area maps showing opp proposed areas also attached separate docs from review s. 1333 the bill repeals entirety establishes similar revenue sharing program leases issued january 2000 however way i 'm reading revenue sharing s. 1330 appears limited coastal states not oil gas production within 100 miles january 2000 this would eliminate revenue sharing gomesa s. 1330 gom states ak revenue sharing pretty much mirrors approach 37.5 states based distance revenue generating lease however 20 funds state allocated political coastal subdivisions s. 1330 amount 40 the annual cap revenues shared 500 million however i read s. 1330 500 million annual cap amount going each state political coastal energy mailto linda_lance energy.senate.gov sent monday july 06 2009 12 pm to subject another revenue question hi guys wondered 'd taken look sen. 's energy bill s. 1333 introduced recess particularly title iii i 'm trying accurate estimate possible loss federal treasury would occur bill enacted as i read section 301 would provide states local governments 37.5 receipts received fiscal year following year enactment leases entered 11 2000 annual cap 500 million 2008 dollars is possible ballpark likely receipts leases assume enacted 2009 receipts start flowing states 2010 in files i saw estimates years ago taking receipts 50-60 years still accurate they may assumed moratoria longer effect what would suggest accurate way estimate in past get upper limit 've simply estimated amt royalties available technically andor economically recoverable resources produced current royalty rate there may something specific limitations bill would better or may accurate assume 500 million cap applicable forseeable future since 37.5 annual receipts seems consistently exceeding number any estimates could develop without significant pain would much appreciated not worth lot new analysis would appreciate thoughts many thanks always
